cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.CG 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of extending partial functions to satisfy fundamental properties in combinatorial optimization, which is a topic that falls under the scope of computer science. The paper also discusses the applications of this problem to learning and property testing, which are subfields of computer science. Based on these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CC (Computational Complexity), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) and computational geometry (cs.CG) in some parts, which makes these sub-categories likely as well.
